attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear sir,
 
This is a desperate plea for help.  
I am a british citizen living in south africa.  I am desperate to return to england.  
South africa is crime filled and dangerous.  Ifear for my life as well as my loved ones.  I have tried despeately to find work, but have been declined 
due to affirimative action.
We live in a caravan park, that my cousin pays for or we would be destitute. I long to return to england, and have my british passport.
I have asked a family member to email you this plea as we have no access to a computer.  her name is Gaylyn Bedingfield.
I have read that british citizens from Zimbabwe  have been flown home.  We are in the same boat,  we get a food donation once a month if there are any left. 
My wife and I would be so grateful if we were shown the same mercy as the Zimbabwe citizens.
I pray for assistance.
I will do england proud.
Please forward this to the appropriate people.
  
Sincerely
Simon Healey.  CELL 0796085762
 
Passport number70....
DOB.  FEB 9TH 1960.
 
MANY thanks and in desperation.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
